info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 6 at 4:06PM PDT until June 6 at 5:00PM PDT by NWS Reno NV
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of east central California, including the following county, Mono.
* WHEN...Until 500 PM PDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 402 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Rapid stream rises may cause minor flooding in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 0.8 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of Northern Mono County near Mount Emma, Eagle Peak, Walker Mountain, the headwaters of the Little Walker River, and the northern Hoover Wilderness. - Obsidian Campground. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON
